26.verse: But the Comforter, which is the holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my Name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, which I have told you.

27.verse: Peace I leave with you: my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, nor fear.

28.verse: Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and will come unto you. If ye loved me, ye would verily rejoice, because I said, I go unto the Father: for the Father is greater than I.

29.verse: And now have I spoken unto you, before it come, that when it is come to pass, ye might believe.

30.verse: Hereafter will I not speak many things unto you: for the prince of this world cometh, and hath nought in me,

31.verse: But it is that the world may know that I love my Father: and as the Father hath commanded me, so I do. Arise, let us go hence.

1.verse: 1 By the parable of the vine, 2 and the branches, 5, 6 he declareth how the disciples may bear fruit. 12, 17 He commendeth mutual love. 18 He exhorteth them to bear afflictions patiently, 20 by his own example. I am that true vine, and my Father is that husbandman.

2.verse: Every branch that beareth not fruit in me, he taketh away: and everyone that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

3.verse: Now are ye clean through the word, which I have spoken unto you.

4.verse: Abide in me, and I in you: as the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine, no more can ye, except ye abide in me.

5.verse: I am that vine: ye are the branches: he that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me can ye do nothing.

6.verse: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and withereth: and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they burn.

7.verse: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ask what ye will, and it shall be done to you.

8.verse: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit, and be made my disciples.

9.verse: As the father hath loved me, so have I loved you: continue in that my love.

10.verse: If ye shall keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love, as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and abide in his love.

11.verse: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.

12.verse: This is my commandment, that ye love one another, as I have loved you.

13.verse: Greater love than this hath no man, when any man bestoweth his life for his friends.

14.verse: Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.

15.verse: Henceforth call I you not servants: for the servant knoweth not what his master doeth: but I have called you friends: for all things that I have heard of my Father, have I made known to you.

16.verse: Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that ye go and bring forth fruits, and that your fruit remain, that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my Name, he may give it you.

17.verse: These things command I you, that ye love one another.

18.verse: If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me before you.

19.verse: If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.

20.verse: Remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than his master. If they have persecuted me, they will persecute you also: if they have kept my word, they will also keep yours.

21.verse: But all these things will they do unto you for my Name’s sake, because they have not known him that sent me.

22.verse: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they should not have had sin: but now have they no cloak for their sin.

23.verse: He that hateth me, hateth my Father also.

24.verse: If I had not done works among them which none other man did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen, and have hated both me, and my Father.

25.verse: But it is that the word might be fulfilled, that is written in their Law, They hated me without a cause.

26.verse: But when that Comforter shall come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth of the Father, he shall testify of me.

27.verse: And ye shall witness also, because ye have been with me from the beginning.

1.verse: 1 He foretelleth the disciples of persecution. 7 He promiseth the Comforter, and declareth his office. 21 He compareth the affliction of his, to a woman that travaileth with child. These things have I said unto you, that ye should not be offended.

2.verse: They shall excommunicate you: yea the time shall come, that whosoever killeth you, will think that he doeth God service.

3.verse: And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

4.verse: But these things have I told you, that when the hour shall come, ye might remember, that I told you them. And these things said I not unto you from the beginning, because I was with you.

5.verse: But now I go my way to him that sent me, and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

6.verse: But because I have said these things unto you, your hearts are full of sorrow.

7.verse: Yet I tell you the truth, It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, that Comforter will not come unto you: but if I depart, I will send him unto you,

8.verse: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment.

9.verse: Of sin, because they believed not in me:

10.verse: Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye shall see me no more.

11.verse: Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

12.verse: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

13.verse: Howbeit, when he is come which is the spirit of truth, he will lead you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself, but whatsoever he shall hear, shall he speak, and he will show you the things to come.

14.verse: He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall show it unto you.

15.verse: All things that the Father hath, are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and show it unto you.

16.verse: A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again a little while, and ye shall see me: for I go to the Father.

17.verse: Then said some of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith unto us, A little while, and ye shall not see me, and again a little while, and ye shall see me, and, For I go to the Father.

18.verse: They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while? we know not what he saith.

19.verse: Now Jesus knew that they would ask him, and said unto them, Do ye inquire among yourselves, of that I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?

20.verse: Verily, verily I say unto you, that ye shall weep and lament, and the world shall rejoice, and ye shall sorrow, but your sorrow shall be turned to joy.

21.verse: A woman when she travaileth hath sorrow because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

22.verse: And ye now therefore are in sorrow: but I will see you again, and your hearts shall rejoice, and your joy shall no man take from you.

23.verse: And in that day shall ye ask me nothing. Verily, verily I say unto you, whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my Name, he will give it you.

24.verse: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my Name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.

25.verse: These things have I spoken unto you in parables: but the time will come, when I shall no more speak to you in parables: but I shall show you plainly of the Father.

26.verse: At that day shall ye ask in my Name, and I say not unto you, that I will pray unto the Father for you:

27.verse: For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.

28.verse: I am come out from the Father, and came into the world: again I leave the world, and go to the Father.

29.verse: His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and thou speakest no parable.

30.verse: Now know we that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee. By this we believe, that thou art come out from God.

31.verse: Jesus answered them, Do you believe now?

32.verse: Behold, the hour cometh, and is already come, that ye shall be scattered every man into his own, and shall leave me alone: But I am not alone: for the Father is with me.

33.verse: These things have I spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace: in the world ye shall have affliction, but be of good comfort: I have overcome the world.

1.verse: 1 Christ prayeth that his glory together with his Father’s may be made manifest. 9 He Prayeth for his Apostles, 20 and for all believers. These things spake Jesus, and lift up his eyes to heaven, and said, Father, that hour is come: glorify thy Son, that thy Son also may glorify thee,

2.verse: As thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to all them that thou hast given him.

3.verse: And this is life eternal, that they know thee to be the only very God, and whom thou hast sent, Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I have glorified thee on the earth: I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.

5.verse: And now glorify me, thou Father, with thine own self, with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.

6.verse: I have declared thy Name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world: thine they were, and thou gavest them me, and they have kept thy word.

7.verse: Now they know that all things whatsoever thou hast given me, are of thee.

8.verse: For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me, and they have received them, and have known surely that I came out from thee, and have believed that thou hast sent me.

9.verse: I pray for them: I pray not for the world, but for them which thou hast given me: for they are thine.

10.verse: And all mine are thine, and thine are mine, and I am glorified in them.

11.verse: And now am I no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in thy Name, even them whom thou hast given me, that they may be one as we are.

12.verse: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy Name: those that thou gavest me, have I kept, and none of them is lost, but the child of perdition, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

13.verse: And now come I to thee, and these things speak I in the world, that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves.

14.verse: I have given them thy word, and the world hath hated them, because they are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

15.verse: I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou keep them from evil.

16.verse: They are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

17.verse: Sanctify them with thy truth: thy word is truth.

18.verse: As thou didst send me into the world, so have I sent them into the world.

19.verse: And for their sakes sanctify I myself, that they also may be sanctified through the truth.

20.verse: I pray not for these alone, but for them also which shall believe in me, through their word,

21.verse: That they all may be one, as thou, O Father, art in me, and I in thee: even that they may be also one in us, that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.

22.verse: And the glory that thou gavest me, I have given them, that they may be one, as we are one,

23.verse: I in them, and thou in me, that they may be made perfect in one, and that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and hast loved them as thou hast loved me.

24.verse: Father, I will that they which thou hast given me, be with me even where I am, that they may behold that my glory, which thou hast given me: for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.

25.verse: O righteous Father, the world also hath not known thee, but I have known thee, and these have known, that thou hast sent me.

26.verse: And I have declared unto them thy Name, and will declare it, that the love wherewith thou hast loved me, may be in them, and I in them.

1.verse: By Christ’s power, whom Judas betrayeth, 6 the soldiers are cast down to the ground. 13 Christ is led to Annas, and from him to Caiaphas. 22, 23 His answer to the officer that smote him with a rod. 28 Being delivered to Pilate, 36 he declareth his kingdom. When Jesus had spoken these things, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, and his disciples.

2.verse: And Judas which betrayed him knew also the place: for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.

3.verse: Judas then, after he had received a band of men and officers of the high Priests, and of the Pharisees, came thither with lanterns and torches, and weapons.

4.verse: Then Jesus, knowing all things that should come unto him, went forth and said unto them, Whom seek ye?

5.verse: They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus said unto them, I am he. Now Judas also which betrayed him, stood with them.

6.verse: As soon then as he had said unto them, I am he, they went away backwards, and fell to the ground.

7.verse: Then he asked them again, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.

8.verse: Jesus answered, I said unto you, that I am he: therefore if ye seek me, let these go their way.

9.verse: This was that the word might be fulfilled which he spake, Of them which thou gavest me, have I lost none.

10.verse: Then Simon Peter having a sword, drew it, and smote the high Priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. Now the servants name was Malchus.

11.verse: Then said Jesus unto Peter, Put up thy sword into the sheath: shall I not drink of the cup which my Father hath given me?

12.verse: Then the band and the captain, and the officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him.

13.verse: And led him away to Annas first (for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, which was the high Priest that same year.)

14.verse: And Caiaphas was he, that gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

15.verse: ¶ Now Simon Peter followed Jesus, and another disciple, and that disciple was known of the high Priest: therefore he went in with Jesus into the hall of the high Priest.

16.verse: But Peter stood at the door without. Then went out the other disciple which was known unto the high Priest, and spake to her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.

17.verse: Then said the maid that kept the door, unto Peter, Art not thou also one of this man’s disciples? He said, I am not.

18.verse: And the servants and officers stood there, which had made a fire of coals: for it was cold, and they warmed themselves. And Peter also stood among them, and warmed himself.

19.verse: ¶ (The high Priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine,

20.verse: Jesus answered him, I spake openly to the world: I ever taught in the Synagogue and in the Temple, whither the Jews resort continually, and in secret have I said nothing.

21.verse: Why askest thou me? ask them which heard me what I said unto them: behold, they know what I said.

22.verse: When he had spoken these things, one of the officers which stood by, smote Jesus with his rod, saying, Answerest thou the high Priest so?

23.verse: Jesus answered him, If I have evil spoken, bear witness of the evil: but if I have well spoken, why smitest thou me?

24.verse: ¶ Now Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high Priest.)

25.verse: And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself, and they said unto him, Art not thou also of his disciples? He denied it, and said, I am not.

26.verse: One of the servants of the high Priest, his cousin whose ear Peter smote off, said, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?

27.verse: Peter then denied again, and immediately the cock crew.

28.verse: Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas into the common hall. Now it was morning, and they themselves went not into the common hall, lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat the Passover.

29.verse: Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?

30.verse: They answered, and said unto him, If he were not an evil doer, we would not have delivered him unto thee.

31.verse: Then said Pilate unto them, Take ye him, and judge him after your own Law. Then the Jews said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death.

32.verse: It was that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled which he spake, signifying what death he should die.

33.verse: So Pilate entered into the common hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the king of the Jews?

34.verse: Jesus answered him, Sayest thou that of thyself, or did others tell it thee of me?

35.verse: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation, and the high Priest have delivered thee unto me. What hast thou done?

36.verse: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, my servants would surely fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.

37.verse: Pilate then said unto him, Art thou a King then? Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I am a King: for this cause am I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth: everyone that is of the truth, heareth my voice.

38.verse: Pilate said unto him, What is truth? And when he had said that, he went out again unto the Jews, and said unto them, I find in him no cause at all.

39.verse: But you have a custom that I should deliver you one loose at the Passover: will ye then that I loose unto you the King of the Jews?

40.verse: Then cried they all again, saying, Not him, but Barabbas: now this Barabbas was a murderer.

1.verse: Pilate, when Christ was scourged, 2 and crowned with thorns, 4 was desirous to let him loose: 8 but being overcome with the outrage of the Jews, 16 he delivereth him to be crucified. 26 Jesus committeth his mother to the disciple. 30 Having tasted vinegar, he dieth: 34 and being dead, his side is pierced with a spear. 40 He is buried. Then Pilate took Jesus and scourged him.

2.verse: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and put it on his head, and they put on him a purple garment,

3.verse: And said, Hail King of the Jews. And they smote him with their rods.

4.verse: Then Pilate went forth again, and said unto them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know, that I find no fault in him at all.

5.verse: Then came Jesus forth wearing a crown of thorns, and a purple garment. And Pilate said unto them, Behold the man.

6.verse: Then when the high Priests and officers saw him, they cried, saying, Crucify, crucify him. Pilate said unto them, Take ye him, and crucify him: for I find no fault in him.

7.verse: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

8.verse: ¶ When Pilate then heard that word, he was the more afraid,

9.verse: And went again into the common hall, and said unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him none answer.

10.verse: Then said Pilate unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? Knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to loose thee?

11.verse: Jesus answered, Thou couldest have no power at all against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee, hath the greater sin.

12.verse: From thenceforth Pilate sought to loose him, but the Jews cried, saying, If thou deliver him, thou art not Caesar’s friend: for whosoever maketh himself a King, speaketh against Caesar.

13.verse: ¶ When Pilate heard this word, he brought Jesus forth, and sat down in the judgment seat in a place called the pavement, and in Hebrew, Gabbatha.

14.verse: And it was the Preparation of the Passover, and about the sixth hour: and he said unto the Jews, Behold your King.

15.verse: But they cried, Away with him, away with him, crucify him. Pilate said unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The high Priests answered, We have no King but Caesar.

16.verse: Then delivered he him unto them, to be crucified. And they took Jesus, and led him away.

17.verse: And he bare his own cross, and came into a place named of dead men’s skulls, which is called in Hebrew, Golgotha:

18.verse: Where they crucified him, and two other with him, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.

19.verse: ¶ And Pilate wrote also a title, and put it on the cross, and it was written, JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.

20.verse: This title then read many of the Jews: for the place where Jesus was crucified, was near to the city: and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.

21.verse: Then said the high Priests of the Jews to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews, but that he said, I am the King of the Jews.

22.verse: Pilate answered, What I have written, I have written.

23.verse: ¶ Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments (and made four parts, to every soldier a part) and his coat: and the coat was without seam woven from the top throughout.

24.verse: ¶ Therefore they said one to another, Let us not divide it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be. This was that the Scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, They parted my garments among them, and on my coat did cast lots. So the soldiers did these things indeed.

25.verse: ¶ Then stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

26.verse: And when Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he said unto his mother, Woman, behold thy son.

27.verse: Then said he to the disciple, Behold thy mother: and from that hour, the disciple took her home unto him.

28.verse: ¶ After, when Jesus knew that all things were performed, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, he said, I thirst.

29.verse: And there was set a vessel full of vinegar: and they filled a sponge with vinegar: and put it about an Hyssop stalk, and put it to his mouth.

30.verse: Now when Jesus had received of the vinegar, he said, It is finished, and bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.

31.verse: The Jews then (because it was the Preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the Sabbath day: for that Sabbath was an high day) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken down.

32.verse: Then came the soldiers and brake the legs of the first, and of the other, which was crucified with Jesus.

33.verse: But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs.

34.verse: But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.

35.verse: And he that saw it, bare record, and his record is true: and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe it.

36.verse: For these things were done, that the Scripture should be fulfilled, Not a bone of him shall be broken.

37.verse: And again another Scripture saith, They shall see him whom they have thrust through.

38.verse: And after these things, Joseph of Arimathea (who was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews) besought Pilate that he might take down the body of Jesus. And Pilate gave him license. He came then and took Jesus’ body.

39.verse: And there came also Nicodemus (which first came to Jesus by night) and brought of myrrh and aloes mingled together about an hundred pounds.

40.verse: Then took they the body of Jesus, and wrapped it in linen clothes with the odors, as the manner of the Jews is to bury.

41.verse: And in that place where Jesus was crucified, was a garden, and in the garden a new sepulcher, wherein was never man yet laid.

42.verse: There then laid they Jesus, because of the Jews’ Preparation day, for the sepulcher was near.

1.verse: 1 Mary bringeth word that Christ is risen: 3 Peter and John 4 run to see it. 15 Jesus appeareth to Mary, 19 and to the disciples that were together in the house, 25 Thomas, before faithless, 29 now believeth. Now the first day of the week came Mary Magdalene, early when it was yet dark, unto the sepulcher, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb.

2.verse: Then she ran, and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulcher, and we know not where they have laid him.

3.verse: Peter therefore went forth, and the other disciple, and they came unto the sepulcher.

4.verse: So they ran both together, but the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulcher.

5.verse: And he stooped down, and saw the linen clothes lying: yet went he not in.

6.verse: Then came Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulcher, and saw the linen clothes lie,

7.verse: And the kerchief that was upon his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.

8.verse: Then went in also the other disciple, which came first to the sepulcher, and he saw it, and believed.

9.verse: For as yet they knew not the Scripture, That he must rise again from the dead.

10.verse: And the disciples went away again unto their own home.

11.verse: ¶ But Mary stood without at the sepulcher weeping: and as she wept, she bowed herself into the sepulcher,

12.verse: And saw two Angels in white, sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

13.verse: And they said unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She said unto them, They have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.

14.verse: When she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

15.verse: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She supposing that he had been the gardener, said unto him, Sir, if thou hast borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

16.verse: Jesus saith unto her, Mary. She turned herself, and said unto him, Rabboni, which is to say, Master.

17.verse: Jesus saith unto her, Touch me not: for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and to your Father, and to my God, and your God.

18.verse: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had spoken these things unto her.

19.verse: ¶ The same day then at night, which was the first day of the week, and when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and said to them, Peace be unto you.

20.verse: And when he had so said, he showed unto them his hands, and his side. Then were the disciples glad when they had seen the Lord.

21.verse: Then said Jesus to them again, Peace be unto you: as my Father sent me, so send I you.

22.verse: And when he had said that, he breathed on them, and said unto them, Receive the holy Ghost.

23.verse: Whosoever’s sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them: and whosoever’s sins ye retain, they are retained.

24.verse: ¶ But Thomas one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

25.verse: The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord: but he said unto them, Except I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put mine hand into his side, I will not believe it.

26.verse: ¶ And eight days after, again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them. Then came Jesus, when the doors were shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace be unto you.

27.verse: After said he to Thomas, Put thy finger here, and see mine hands, and put forth thine hand, and put it into my side, and be not faithless, but faithful.

28.verse: Then Thomas answered, and said unto him, Thou art my Lord, and my God.

29.verse: Jesus said unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou believest: blessed are they that have not seen, and have believed.

30.verse: And many other signs also did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book.

31.verse: But these things are written that ye might believe, that Jesus is that Christ that Son of God, and that in believing ye might have life through his Name.

1.verse: 1 Jesus appeareth to his disciples as they were fishing, 6, 7 whom they know by a miraculous draught of fishes. 15 He committeth the charge of the sheep to Peter, 18 and foretelleth him of the manner of his death. After these things, Jesus showed himself again to his disciples at the sea of Tiberias: and thus showed he himself:

2.verse: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas, which is called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples.

3.verse: Simon Peter said unto them, I go a fishing. They said unto him, We also will go with thee. They went their way and entered into a ship straightway, and that night caught they nothing.

4.verse: But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: nevertheless the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.

5.verse: Jesus then said unto them, Sirs, have ye any meat? They answered him, No.

6.verse: Then he said unto them, Cast out the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find. So they cast out, and they were not able at all to draw it, for the multitude of fishes.

7.verse: Therefore said the disciple whom Jesus loved, unto Peter, It is the Lord. When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girded his coat to him (for he was naked) and cast himself into the sea.

8.verse: But the other disciples came by ship, (for they were not far from land, but about two hundred cubits) and they drew the net with fishes.

9.verse: As soon then as they were come to land, they saw hot coals, and fish laid thereon, and bread.

10.verse: Jesus said unto them, Bring of the fishes, which ye have now caught.

11.verse: Simon Peter stepped forth and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred, fifty and three: and albeit there were so many, yet was not the net broken.

12.verse: Jesus said unto them, Come, and dine. And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou? seeing they knew that he was the Lord.

13.verse: Jesus then came and took bread and gave them, and fish likewise.

14.verse: This is now the third time that Jesus showed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen again from the dead.

15.verse: ¶ So when they had dined, Jesus said to Simon Peter, Simon the son of Jonah, lovest thou me more than these? He said unto him, Yea, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. He said unto him, Feed my lambs.

16.verse: He said to him again the second time, Simon the son of Jonah, lovest thou me? He said unto him, Yea, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. He said unto him, Feed my sheep.

17.verse: He said unto him the third time, Simon the son of Jonah, lovest thou me? Peter was sorry because he said to him the third time, Lovest thou me? and said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things: thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus said unto him, Feed my sheep.

18.verse: Verily, verily I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thine hands, and another shall gird thee, and lead thee without thou wouldest not.

19.verse: And this spake he signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had said this, he said to him, Follow me.

20.verse: Then Peter turned about, and saw the disciple whom JESUS loved, following, which had also leaned on his breast at supper, and had said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?

21.verse: When Peter therefore saw him, he said to Jesus, Lord, what shall this man do?

22.verse: Jesus said unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is it to thee? follow thou me.

23.verse: Then went this word abroad among the brethren, that this disciple should not die. Yet Jesus said not to him, He shall not die: but if I will that he tarry till I come, what is it to thee?

24.verse: This is that disciple, which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things, and we know that his testimony is true.

25.verse: Now there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which if they should be written every one, I suppose the world could not contain the books that should be written, Amen.
